name: Ligurian Focaccia
author: Samin Nosrat
description: Making this gorgeously brown and perfectly crisp bread is also pretty damn relaxing — you just stir together a few ingredients, let it sit overnight, then shape and bake until golden. The salt brining step will seem weird at first, but it’s absolutely essential.
ingredients: 2 tablespoons (18 grams) Diamond Crystal Kosher salt or 1 tablespoon fine sea salt
¼ cup (50 grams) extra-virgin olive oil, plus more for pan and finishing

name: Beef Wellington
author: Gordon Ramsay
description: Beef Wellington is a classic and elegant dish that’s perfect for special occasions. It features a succulent beef tenderloin wrapped in a flavorful mushroom duxelles, then encased in a golden, flaky puff pastry. This dish combines rich and savory flavors with a sophisticated presentation, making it a standout centerpiece for any festive meal.
ingredients: 2 egg yolks, beaten with 1 tbsp water and a pinch of salt
Sea salt and freshly ground black pepper

name: Shawarma
author: Nadiya Hussain
description: Shawarmas are like the kebabs that you can justify as being good for you. Well, they’re not particularly bad for you really, and they are actually quite easy to make. You don’t need a roly thing, or a special bread knife or tray. Let me show you how.
